intro: Machaeranthera canescens, commonly known as the plains coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces a distinctive, hairy stem. Machaeranthera canescens is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
